attributes.action: update the fine for failing to remove a misleading notice likely to deter public use of a right of way
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under section 57 of the National Parks and Access to the Countryside Act 1949, it is an offence to place or maintain a misleading notice on a right of way likely to deter public access.

The original Act specified a fine of up to £5 for this offence (subsection 1), and a fine of up to £2 per day for failing to comply with a court order to remove the notice (subsection 2).

The maximum fine in subsection 1 has since been revised to "level 1 on the standard scale", currently £200.  However, the daily maximum fine specified in subsection 2 has stagnated at £2 ever since; we therefore call on the government to revise it to 40% of the level 1 maximum, i.e. currently £80.

This will restore the deterrent effect as originally intended, both now and for the future.
